text:
SHARE & DISCUSS

Share your findings with your group and discuss what you are learning.

ANALYSIS

Have you collected enough data to answer your research question?

Does it make sense to modify your research question based on what you are discovering?

Are you noticing any patterns in your data? Could there be more?

CLUEâ€™s data cards allow for accessing, sorting, cleaning, and graphing data quickly and easily.

The ease of data manipulation in CLUE helps introduce students to data science. Note that when using the sorting menu, it is easy to see small discrepancies in how the data were recorded. For example, a misspelling of an entry will create a completely separate pile in sorting. It can then easily be corrected and will automatically sort itself into the correct pile, and will make any graph of the data clearer. This cleaning of data is a hallmark of data science.

Data cards can also be combined across groups to generate a class-wide dataset if desired. Students simply publish the data cards to make them available, and the data card tile can then be dragged into another workspace on combined with other tiles.

Suggestions for scaffolding analysis

The data cards may be used in a variety of ways to support analysis.

Students can:

  • Sort cards according to attributes (labels) by using the label drop down menu at the top of the deck.
  • Use the "none" label to see all their cards at once.
  • Create a graph and link a card stack or a table to the graph.
  • Drag labels or use the pull down menu to bring attributes to the x and y axis.
  • Make all kinds of representations to explore the data, before drawing any conclusions.
  • Create a table and link a card stack to the table or vice versa.

Do you want to try to identify your moths?

You can find schemes for identifying moths online, or you can create your own. Below are some common moths from Michigan you may have captured:

This 2-pager provides the top 10 Michigan moths from MothEd 2022-23. Your students may be interested in compiling a similar list for your classes.
